TopicTitle: International construction ISS in Kerbal orbit.

Articles.Content: Now testing parts in .20..
ISS Parts work fine in .20, we can even use the cupola as a placeholder until devo is done.

ISS Parts work fine in .20, we can even use the cupola as a placeholder until devo is done.
They work but they aren't optimized for the new loading system. Squad did say the old way won't be around long...

Obviously you can fix it yourself but it wouldn't be a bad idea to have a 'fixed' version uploaded either for simplicity's sake.
I would, I've compiled them into the folders. But I don't have access to bobcat's spaceport. Legitimate reason, right?
How to fix it?

How to fix it?
http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/30559-20-And-mods

this is soo cool now it is just geting it to space and acembeling it

ISS pack uodate to 0.05 [0.20 fix]
PMA fix, bobcat?
no. If Devo dont fix it in weekend , im make other PMA
Any updates, anyone?
ill fix it up don't worry. I was just testing cupola iva with my cupola, i wish i had internal files for it, would love to get rid of the sticky notes.

Hmmmm, I managed to get a dragon docking port onto the station PMA, all I did was changed docking port module size from 1 to 5...

Edit: I'm an idiot, that's CBM....

I'm an idiot.

That's weird you know, because the PMA doesn't have a docking object...hmm?

Edit: And they go on harmony, not tranquility.

so the PMA can dock with a normal clamp-o-tron and the MIR docking port...

Oh and make sure the PMA is open before you dock it...

Ah, can we get some kind of add-on to keep it in the correct position (I.E facing the sun, its a pane me having to keep moving it to face it every 10 mins)
Not possible right now. I still do not know how they do it in LEO.
hokey kockey.
..what do you mean?
...I was just saying ok, lol.
Update on development, doing MPLM update work, gonna fix that white spot. Also, I'm adding multiple textures for the MPLMs, aka Rafaello and Leonardo.
cool. Cant wat till packs updated!

Not possible right now. I still do not know how they do it in LEO.

Reaction wheels, ISS has four of them and they keep the stations orientation pointing "forward" they also allow the station to spin on the Truss like an Axis so leaving russian spacecraft have an easier time departing ISS. (Flying straight back instead of up then back.)
